text.0: this hymn will i make for the marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down.
text.1: sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown who stay the heat who sacrifice on heights of heaven.
text.2: o maruts rich in water strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds that wander far.
text.3: trita roars out at him who aims the lightningflash the waters sweeping round are thundering on their way.
text.4: they gleam with lightning heroes casters of the stone windrapid maruts overthrowers of the bills.
text.5: oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail roaring in onset violent and exceeding strong.
text.6: when mighty rudras through the nights and through the days when through the sky and realms of air shakers of all.
text.7: when over the broad fields ye drive along like ships een to strongholds ye come maruts but are not harmed.
text.8: maruts this hero strength and majesty of yours hath like the sun extended oer a lengthened way.
text.9: when in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.
text.10: bright shone your host ye sages maruts when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it.
text.11: accordant as the eye guides him who walks have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.
text.12: never is he o maruts slain or overcome never doth he decay neer is distressed or harmed.
text.13: his treasures his resources never waste away whom whether he be prince or Ṛṣi ye direct.
text.14: with harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops the friendly maruts laden with their watercasks.
text.15: let the spring flow and when impetuous they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath.
text.16: free for the maruts is the earth with sloping ways free for the rushing ones is heaven with steep descents.
text.17: the paths of airs midregion are precipitous precipitous the mountains with their running streams.
text.18: when as the sun hath risen up ye take delight o bounteous radiant maruts heroes of the sky.
text.19: your coursers weary not when speeding onṭheir way and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.
text.20: lances are on your shoulders anklets on your feet gold chains are on your breasts gems maruts on your car.
text.21: lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your heads.
text.22: maruts in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven splendid beyond conception for its shining fruit.
text.23: they gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth the pious ones send forth a farresounding shout.
text.24: sage maruts may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful i of life that have been given by you.
text.25: o maruts let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like tisya from the sky.
text.26: maruts ye further wealth with longedfor heroes further the Ṛṣi skilled in chanted verses.
text.27: ye give the bhārata as his strength a charger and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.
text.28: of you most swift to succour i solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the sun.
text.29: accept o maruts graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.
